entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 4:10AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow for the Monday Morning and Monday Evening Commute... Light snow has developed this morning and is expected to intensify in the late afternoon and evening. Snow amounts will not be heavy, with expected amounts of 1 to 3 inches. However, the snowfall will be of the light and fluffy type, which may impact visibility for both commutes, especially along the highways.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Tucker County. * WHEN...Until 6 PM EST this evening.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 2:54AM EST until January 23 at 4:00PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest North Carolina, southwest Virginia and southeast West Virginia.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Western Greenbrier County. * WHEN...Today.
